sn29.21-50:3.1: 21–50 Thirty Discourses On How Giving Helps to Become Womb-Born, etc.
sn29.21-50:4.2: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn29.21-50:4.3: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the womb-born dragons …
sn29.21-50:5.1: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does both kinds of deeds by body, speech, and mind.
sn29.21-50:5.3: ‘The spontaneously-born dragons are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
sn29.21-50:5.5: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons!’
sn29.21-50:5.9: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the spontaneously-born dragons.
sn29.21-50:5.10: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the spontaneously-born dragons.”
sn29.21-50:6.1: (Each set of ten discourses of this series should be treated in the same way.)
sn29.21-50:9.1: The Linked Discourses on dragons are complete.
